description: Global social media firms could face fines of as much as A$50 million ($32.5 million) if they fail to enforce the Australian government’s new social media ban on children under the age of 16, according to legislation set to be introduced on Thursday.
title: Social Media Giants Face $32 Million Fines Under Australia Ban

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk outlines the latest pushback to President-elect Donald Trump from Senate Republicans. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Picks Another Fight With GOP Senators Over Vetting Nominees

description: Prime Minister Justin Trudeau’s government is facing more trouble as one of his cabinet ministers was forced to step aside amid scrutiny over his business dealings.
title: Canada Employment Minister Quits Over Business Ties, Indigenous Claims

description: Japan’s largest labor union chief is calling for Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba’s government to accelerate efforts to boost wages, especially for workers at small firms, as they seek to achieve stronger results for next year’s pay negotiations.
title: Japan Union Chief Calls for Ishiba to Step Up Wage Hike Efforts

description: The Texas Land Commissioner offered 1,402 acres of land in Starr County to be used to construct deportation facilities for the US, an early indicator of how the state is seeking to help President-elect Donald Trump carry out his promised mass crackdown against undocumented immigrants.
title: Texas Offers Trump 1,400 Acres to Help With Mass Deportation

description: President-elect Donald Trump is expected to name Russ Vought to serve as the director of the Office of Management and Budget, according to CBS News, bringing back a trusted former aide to his second administration.
title: Trump Expected to Name Vought to Lead Budget Office, CBS Says

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s team is holding discussions with the digital asset industry about whether to create a new White House post solely dedicated to cryptocurrency policy, according to people familiar with the transition efforts.
title: Trump Team Mulls Creating First-Ever White House Crypto Role

description: Apple Inc. argued in federal court that a US judge should dismiss the Justice Department’s antitrust lawsuit at an early stage because it failed to state how the iPhone maker’s alleged monopoly has harmed any consumers or developers.
title: Apple Urges Judge to Dismiss US Antitrust Lawsuit at Early Stage

description: Egypt has asked the International Monetary Fund to review the targets for the full duration of its $8 billion program, Prime Minister Mostafa Madbouly said.
title: Egypt Seeks to Review Goals Through End of IMF Program, PM Says

description: Donald Trump’s hush-money case should be “immediately” dismissed because continuing with his prosecution would “hamstring the operation” of the US government, his lawyers told a Manhattan judge.
title: Trump Calls for Hush-Money Case to Be Dismissed ‘Immediately’

description: LetterOne Holdings, the UK investment company founded by sanctioned Russian billionaires, failed to overturn a British government-ordered sale of a broadband service provider after a London court ruled the decision was fair and reasonable.
title: Firm Founded by Sanctioned Russians Fails to Overturn Forced Sale of UK Broadband Provider

description: President-elect Donald Trump is poised to skip over FBI vetting of his nominees, upending more than 60 years of precedent and putting him on a collision course with members of his own party as he tries to power his controversial cabinet picks through the Senate.
title: Senators Set to Clash With Trump on FBI Checks for Gaetz, Others

description: Chinese President Xi Jinping and Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva agreed to combine efforts between their infrastructure plans during talks in Brasilia.
title: Xi and Lula Seek Synergy Between Their Infrastructure Programs

description: Michael Barr, the Federal Reserve’s top banking cop, said he plans to serve his entire term when questioned about what he would do if President-elect Donald Trump sought to fire him.
title: Barr Plans to Serve Full Term as Fed’s Top Bank Cop

description: Serbia’s trade minister and railway chief resigned over a growing scandal about a roof collapse at a newly-refurbished railway station that killed 15 people.
title: Serbia Loses Another Minister Amid Rage Over Fatal Roof Collapse

description: President-elect Donald Trump has picked Republican lawyer Matthew Whitaker to be the US Ambassador to NATO, selecting a former loyal aide from his first administration as his envoy to an international alliance he regularly criticizes.
title: Trump Picks Former Attorney General Whitaker as NATO Ambassador

description: As Democrats try to figure out why the country lurched so dramatically toward Republican candidates in this year’s election, one congressman’s analysis of what went wrong has garnered particular attention — and backlash. Representative Seth Moulton, a Democrat from Massachusetts, says his party faltered because it’s not willing to have debates on issues that Americans care about, including whether transgender girls should be allowed to participate in girls’ sports.
title: ‘We’re Banning Discussions’: Moulton Says Democrats Fear Issues

description: Mozambique’s post-election unrest has left at least 67 people dead over the past month, according to a local monitoring group that’s been tracking the violence.
title: Mozambique Election Unrest Leaves at Least 67 Dead, Group Says

description: One of the White House’s most senior Middle East envoys will travel to Tel Aviv from Beirut on Wednesday, in a bid to clinch a cease-fire in the war between Israel and Hezbollah.
title: US Envoy Heading From Lebanon to Israel in Bid to Clinch Truce

description: Russia restricted cryptocurrency mining in more than a dozen regions where the practice is concentrated amid concern over electricity shortages that are weighing on the nation’s economy.
title: Russia to Limit Cryptomining in Some Regions on Power Shortages

description: Iran’s pledge to cease stockpiling uranium enriched close to the levels needed for nuclear weapons was made unconditionally and is the first time the nation has made such a proposal, according to the United Nations atomic watchdog.
title: Iran Vow to Cap Enriched Uranium Stock Unconditional, IAEA Says

description: Ukrainian forces fired British cruise missiles at military targets inside Russia for the first time, expanding the use of Western-provided long-range weapons as the 1,000-day conflict enters a new phase.
title: Ukraine Fires UK Cruise Missiles at Russia for First Time

description: South Africa’s government expects to complete a revision of its national energy blueprint this month and submit the proposed changes to lawmakers by the end of the first quarter, Electricity Minister Kgosientsho Ramokgopa said.
title: South Africa’s Energy Plan to Be Submitted to Lawmakers by March

description: Hungary is moving toward allowing an increase in the cost of a contract with Russia to expand its sole nuclear power station a decade after the deal was signed.
title: Hungary Moves to Allow Russia to Hike Price of Nuclear Contract

description: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan pledged that minimum wage increases will continue to outpace inflation next year and that workers’ purchasing power would be safeguarded amid lingering price pressures.
title: Erdogan Pledges Minimum Wage Hike Will Outpace Inflation in 2025

description: The US is in the midst of a “revolutionary situation,” says the author of End Times.
title: Trump and the Triumph of America’s New Elite

description: Militants operating in the eastern Democratic Republic of Congo are violating the terms of a peace accord that was signed in late July and the civilian population is suffering as a result, the head of a regional trading bloc said.
title: Militants Violating Congo Cease-Fire Deal, Regional Bloc Says

description: A panel of British lawmakers plans to invite Elon Musk to testify in Parliament about X’s role in spreading disinformation during the UK’s summer riots.
title: UK Lawmakers Plan to Ask Musk to Give Evidence on Summer Riots

description: A Pakistani court granted bail to former Prime Minister Imran Khan in a case where he is accused of hiding income but he won’t be freed from jail as he is under arrest in other cases.
title: Pakistan Court Grants Bail to Ex-Prime Minister Imran Khan

description: Nicolás Maduro was hoping for a “fresh start” with the US under Donald Trump. Instead, he’s getting déjà vu.
title: Biden’s Move on Venezuela Leaves Trump Little Room to Cut a Deal

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: President Xi Navigates China Through a Chaotic World

description: A prominent Tunisian politician who tried unsuccessfully to stand against President Kais Saied in last month’s elections is undergoing treatment for serious burns sustained from an acid attack.
title: Tunisia Opposition Leader Hospitalized After Acid Attack at Home

description: Danish Prime Minister Mette Frederiksen said she would not be taken aback if the severing of two data cables in the Baltic Sea a few days ago was found to be intentional.
title: Danish PM ‘Not Surprised’ If Sabotage Caused Subsea Cable Damage

description: Ghana’s Supreme Court will decide on the constitutionality of a controversial anti-LGBTQ bill after next month’s presidential elections, Citi FM reported.
title: Ghana to Rule on LGBTQ Bill Legality After Vote, Citi FM Reports

description: A former Vietnam deputy trade minister and an ex-provincial party chief are facing bribery charges tied to an oil company in a Ho Chi Minh City trial that began Wednesday, part of an ongoing drive to root out corruption in the Southeast Asian communist country.
title: Vietnam Ex-Deputy Minister Among 15 in Oil Firm Bribery Trial

description: Ugandan opposition leader Kizza Besigye is being held in a military jail after being detained in neighboring Kenya’s capital over the weekend and moved to Kampala, according to his wife.
title: Uganda Opposition Leader Besigye ‘Kidnapped’ in Kenya, Wife Says

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s policies on tariffs, fiscal stimulation and immigration will likely push the US toward missing its 2% inflation target, Bridgewater Associates Co-Chief Investment Officer Bob Prince said on Wednesday.
title: Bridgewater Says Trump May Pick More Accommodating Fed Chief

description: Poland’s Foreign Minister Radoslaw Sikorski said his country supports the initiative to issue European joint bonds to finance defense spending.
title: Poland Says Backs Joint European Bonds to Finance Defense

description: Russia said it was ready to talk with US President-elect Donald Trump about a potential cease-fire with Ukraine, stoking speculation about how the conflict will eventually end even as it has intensified on all fronts.
title: Russia Stirs Ukraine Truce Speculation With Eye on Trump

description: Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba struck a deal with a key opposition party over his economic stimulus package, by promising that discussion of the opposition’s tax cut proposals will be included among the measures, according to Makoto Hamaguchi, a senior official in Japan’s Democratic Party for the People.
title: Ishiba Gets Green Light for Stimulus With Tax Talks Pledge

description: Thailand risks missing its growth target next year if President-elect Donald Trump follows through with his pledge to raise tariffs on imports into the US as it could hurt the Southeast Asian nation’s exports and weaken its currency, according to a study.
title: Thai Economy Seen Taking $4.6 Billion Hit From Trump Tariff Plan

description: Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund — chaired by Crown Prince Mohammed Bin Salman — has become a key vehicle for the kingdom to silence international criticism, Human Rights Watch said in a report.
title: Saudi Wealth Fund a Tool to Silence Critics, Human Rights Watch Says

description: The focus this week has been on US missiles. But one of the biggest challenges remains getting enough soldiers to the front line.
title: As Ukraine Struggles With Manpower, One Brigade Is Recruiting

description: On this week’s Voternomics, author Peter Turchin explains why Donald Trump’s return isn’t a surprise, and what it represents.
title: History’s Sobering Warning About America’s Future

description: The US will provide Ukraine with antipersonnel land mines to blunt the advance of Russian troops, an official familiar with the decision said, the latest effort by the Biden administration to bolster support for Kyiv ahead of President-elect Donald Trump’s inauguration.
title: US Will Provide Land Mines to Ukraine After Approval on Missiles

description: Taiwanese Foreign Minister Lin Chia-lung started his weeklong trip to Europe with a stop in Brussels that’s likely to trigger Beijing.
title: Taiwan Minister Kicks Off Europe Trip With Stop in Brussels

description: Years of high-profile intercontinental ballistic missile tests by North Korea have fallen short of demonstrating that Pyongyang can successfully launch and deliver a nuclear warhead against the US mainland, the head of American forces in the Indo-Pacific said.
title: North Korea Hasn’t Perfected ICBM Warheads, US Admiral Says

description: President-elect Donald Trump’s dramatic search for a Treasury secretary continues as he’s scheduled to hold interviews Wednesday with former Federal Reserve Governor Kevin Warsh and Apollo Global Management Inc.’s Marc Rowan, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Trump’s Treasury Search Gains Steam With Fresh Round of Meetings

description: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. said a Filipina on death row in Indonesia is going to be repatriated, thanking Prabowo Subianto’s government for its goodwill.
title: Marcos Says Indonesia Agrees to Repatriate Filipina on Death Row

description: India’s western state of Maharashtra holds local elections Wednesday, a vote that not only tests the support for Prime Narendra Modi and his party but that could have far-reaching consequences for a region that drives the nation’s economy.
title: India’s Economic Powerhouse Seeks Stability in State Elections

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.As the caipirinhas flowed and samba dancers swayed for VIP guests gathered for the Group of 20 summit in Rio de Janiero, the party mood suddenly turned sour.
title: G-20 Summit Exposes Global Divides Over War and Trade
